function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Limited data collection from a specific location, period, and language may not represent a comprehensive picture of noise complaints and sources.","Impact":"Inaccurate understanding of noise patterns and sources, leading to ineffective mitigation measures.","Mitigation":"Expand social media analysis to wider ranges at the national or international level with various languages.","Technologies":"Social media data mining tools, natural language processing for multilingual analysis.","People":"Researchers, urban planners, public health officials.","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies."},{"Description":"Manual identification of noise sources from social media data limits the scalability and accuracy of the analysis.","Impact":"Inefficiency in identifying and addressing noise sources, especially in large-scale data sets.","Mitigation":"Adopt machine learning approaches to automatically detect sound sources in large-scale social media data.","Technologies":"Machine learning algorithms, data labeling tools, automation software.","People":"Data scientists, machine learning experts, social media analysts.","Owner":"Research institutions, technology companies."},{"Description":"Lack of objective data on noise measurement and sound insulation of buildings hinders accurate assessment of indoor noise sources.","Impact":"Inability to accurately assess the impact of building sound insulation on noise complaints and propagation.","Mitigation":"Implement low-cost and portable measurement systems using smartphones and Raspberry Pi for indoor noise measurements. Collect additional building data such as year of construction and window type for improved assessment.","Technologies":"Smartphone microphone, Raspberry Pi, data collection apps, building information databases.","People":"Building engineers, architects, data scientists.","Owner":"Building management companies, research institutions."}]}
